posts.post_text: January 18, 2019 at 6:40 PM#3but this method works only with one executor at the time. Is there also a method for multiple pre loaded executers? I want to press one Macro and all my loaded Cues should start.Greetings from Germany

posts.author: Moe696
posts.post_text: January 18, 2019 at 10:37 PM#4You can select multiple executors by HOLDING the select button and then pressing the executors you want to fire simultaneously.Another option would be to assign a ratemaster (e.g. Ratemaster 1) to all your executors in the assign menu.Assign the ratemaster to an executor.Then you set the ratemaster at zero and go (not load) all the executors you want.By raising up the ratemaster the cues start at the same time.All cues have to have a fadetime and (if you have snapped attributes) a snap percent value above zero for this to work.
